The labor force participation rate: The expert looked at the labor force participation rate, which is a measurement of the health of the labor market. Comparison to historical data: The expert compared the current labor force participation rate to historical data to determine if it was indeed the lowest in over three decades. Examination of other job indicators: The expert acknowledged that while the labor force participation rate is an important measure, there are other indicators to consider when evaluating the health of the labor market. Consideration of external factors: The expert recognized that it is challenging to attribute the state of the labor force solely to Obama's policies.
